channel.title: This is ridiculous! Cannabis in the UK, going to a class B drug?
channel.description:
http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/uk_politics/6904547.stm
Cannabis laws set to be reviewed Cannabis Cannabis laws have proved controversial Laws making possession of cannabis a largely non-arrestable offence could be reversed, Gordon Brown has said. The prime minister told MPs a consultation on reclassifying cannabis will be launched next week as part of a review of the entire UK drugs strategy. The drug was downgraded to class C - which includes things such as anabolic steroids - from class B, which includes things like amphetamines, in 2004. But there are fears more harmful forms of the drug have become available. A Home Office spokesman said the Advisory Council on the Misuse of Drugs (ACMD) will be asked to review reports that danger from cannabis is increasing due to wider availability of more potent strains such as "skunk". There is concern stronger varieties of the drug can cause mental health problems. Medicinal use Mr Brown said the Cabinet had discussed the issue and Home Secretary Jacqui Smith would publish a consultation document next week about the UK drugs strategy. Recently, there have been various forms of herbal or grass-type cannabis that are generally found to be stronger than ordinary 'weed' Home Office drugs advice website Mr Brown told MPs at prime minister's questions: "She will be asking the public to comment on new ways in which we can improve drugs education in the country, give support to people undergoing treatment... and give support for communities who want to chase out drug dealers from their communities." He was responding to a question from Labour MP Martin Salter who, referring to the medicinal use of cannabis, urged a drugs policy that did not "criminalise the sick but tackles the drugs that do the most harm". The issue of downgrading - or even decriminalising - cannabis - has proved controversial and has already been reviewed once by the Home Office. Urgent research The original move from Class B to Class C was made when David Blunkett was home secretary. His successor Charles Clarke asked for a review in 2005. At that time the ACMD said that while cannabis was undoubtedly harmful it was still less harmful than other drugs like amphetamines which are in Class B. It recommended no change. But it also called for urgent further research on the potency and pattern of cannabis use. If the ACMD were to back a change in classification and the Home Office accepted its recommendation, it would require agreement of both houses of Parliament to become law. Potent varieties A Home Office spokesman said: "We will be asking the ACMD to review the classification of cannabis, given the increase in strength of some cannabis strains and their potential harms. "It would be wrong to prejudge that review which shows how seriously we take our priority of reducing drug-related harm." The Home Office's drugs information website, Frank, includes details of new more potent varieties of cannabis. It says: "Recently, there have been various forms of herbal or grass-type cannabis that are generally found to be stronger than ordinary 'weed', containing on average two to three times the amount of the active compound, THC. "These include sinsemilla (a bud grown in the absence of male plants and which has no seeds), homegrown, skunk (which has a particular strong smell) and netherweed."
This is absurd! I thought lib dems wanted it to be legalized.

item.title: This is ridiculous! Cannabis in the UK, going to a class B drug?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

jme_009:

As for the glass in the marijuana, get better sources. I always get it straight from trusted growers, not street corner dealers etc.

Agreed, but you can’t blame the guy 100%, a while back the UK had a big infestation of this weed with sand and glass and shit in it, it got everywhere like a dodgy STD, i was offered it a few times and I thought I only knew cool dealers.

UK sucks sometimes.

Read full topic

item.title: This is ridiculous! Cannabis in the UK, going to a class B drug?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“fellixombc, post:32, topic:124558”]I

[sie=1pt]no spam here cause you just read this.[/size][/quote]

Off topic is still spam.

jme_009:

As for the glass in the marijuana, get better sources. I always get it straight from trusted growers, not street corner dealers etc. And if you ask me, strains with more THC are less harmful because you need to smoke less to achieve desirable effects. Thats my opinion anyways, makes sense to me. I mean like hash oil, I recently tried it and after just a single hit I was higher then marijuana has ever gotten me high. I did two hits, which is much lower compared to the amount of smoke intake you would need from some shit quality weed.

Exactly. Around here, solid as we call hashish is more popular because you need to buy more weed, witch is more expensive($30 an eighth for weed, $18 an eighth of hashish) just to get high, and hashish usually lasts longer.

CrushMe:

It does as it contains a more Thc. No more different chemicals in it, however as alot of places are going dry where i live some dealers have been putting small amounts of crushed glass in it in order to make it look like “more”.

That’s why I buy direct from growers witch are extremely good friends of mine. Dealers charge more for personal gain and make druggies look even worse.

CrushMe:

To get more on topic i reckon cannabis is going to a b to try and stop the skunk and super skunk because of its huge health risks.

No it’s going to class b, because of again, dealers. One of my friends caught a dealer selling shit outside a fucking school so we jumped him. Shit like this happens all the time, some dealers just get fucked off their faces before selling and don’t give a shit who they sell it to, police catch on and blame the drugs.

p0unding:

Im really really sorry! apologie accepted? XD

Yes. Me too, sorry.

Read full topic

item.title: This is ridiculous! Cannabis in the UK, going to a class B drug?
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

CrushMe:

Can be taken via a joint. Also the stuff i buy is x60 so it dosn’t take much to get the full blast.

That may be possible, but I find it unlikely. Salvinorin A, the main psychoactive chemical in Salvia, needs to be vaporized at a much higher temperture. A constant flame needs to be held on it, and for best results a butane torch should be used. The smoke isn’t really what gets you high, it’s the vaporized chemical that you are looking for. Also a joint is such a waste, a proper hit of 60x from a pipe or bong would send you into a hardcore mind blowing world in your own head. 2 grams of 40x salvia has gotten me and 2 other friends high everyday for the past week.

As for the glass in the marijuana, get better sources. I always get it straight from trusted growers, not street corner dealers etc. And if you ask me, strains with more THC are less harmful because you need to smoke less to achieve desirable effects. Thats my opinion anyways, makes sense to me. I mean like hash oil, I recently tried it and after just a single hit I was higher then marijuana has ever gotten me high. I did two hits, which is much lower compared to the amount of smoke intake you would need from some shit quality weed.

Read full topic

item.source: This is ridiculous! Cannabis in the UK, going to a class B drug?

item.title: This is ridiculous! Cannabis in the UK, going to a class B drug?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

You mean those huge health risks that the media made up? Yeah, must stop those.

Skunk is just a strain. If you’re going to tell me it’s somehow more dangerous than other high-potency strains, I’m going to laugh. If you’re going to tell me it has somehow got “different chemicals” in it (a nurse told me this the other day) I will laugh.

I guess I could believe that stronger weed may carry mental health risks, but I hate how the media makes it into something that it isn’t.

Read full topic

item.title: This is ridiculous! Cannabis in the UK, going to a class B drug?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

CrushMe:

Old school Cannabis is good, still smoke that stuff, however im experimenting stuff like this http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Salvia_divinorum Very good stuff this, 100% legal where i come from (Uk). A joint of it feels like 4hours but is really 10-15mins, it warps time and visualness, you hallucinate. As for cannabis well ive smoked so much it dosn’t do much to me just makes my pupils either huge or tiny, i miss the old chilled “stoned” feeling. Going to B probably to scare people, but if you like it enough and are only carrying £10 worth, you wont give a shit.

If you can get visuals from a joint of Salvia Divinorum, you’re a very very unusual person. Salvanorin A isn’t absorbed like that, you need a decent dose all at once to break through.

Read full topic

I might buy an ounce or so. Pick out all the seeds and I’ll be sorted.

KILL HIM!!!
Mary Jane for life <3

Yeah.

In Britain the connection between the MPs and the Unions and the Unions to the working class people is a bit sketchy. As the US and UK prepare for continuation of the “War on Terror” (war for oil) on an even larger scale in the Middle East, it makes sense that the governments will crack down harder on groups who think independently and do not submit to the rule of law.

Governments, who needs em? We should start a new country.

All in favor of starting your own country called The Un-Named Land, speak now or forever hold your peace.

I.

I.
[/quote]

I…[/quote]
I.

Not that it makes much difference to me personally, I was smoking when it was class B originally.

At least Labour will be gone in two years. Not that the tories are much better.
